top_categories.workout_context: 73ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
West Coast Gravel's Oregon coast, Coastal gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 55 miles.
At West Coast Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of West Coast Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
Race-pace efforts that mimic West Coast Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
Varied gradients on Oregon coast gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At West Coast Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Smooth pedaling at 55 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
When someone attacks on Oregon coast gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
55 miles on Oregon coast gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Low-cadence force work for 4,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for West Coast Gravel’s 55 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at West Coast Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on oregon coast gravel to build confidence. Expect: oregon coast, coastal gravel, pacific northwest.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 55 miles of oregon coast gravel in Yachats, OR.
